result.execSummary:
The defendant James C Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to the State of Nevada.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL. Refund bail to poster.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with victim.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Attend Domestic Abuse Violence course/class.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
